q: Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.
h:
“Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
h:
“Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Those who seek the easy way do not seek the true way.
h:
“Those who seek the easy way do not seek the true way.” —
Dogen

q: If I can laugh, I can live.
h:
“If I can laugh, I can live.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.
h:
“Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.” —
Unknown

q: It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.
h:
“It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
h:
“The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
h:
“You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: What is planted in each person's soul will sprout.
h:
“What is planted in each person's soul will sprout. ” —
Rumi

q: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
h:
“Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: We think too much and feel too little.
h:
“We think too much and feel too little.” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
h:
“A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
h:
“Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Never give way to laziness.
h:
“Never give way to laziness.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!
h:
“Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: I'd rather welcome change than cling to the past.
h:
“I'd rather welcome change than cling to the past.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
h:
“We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.
h:
“Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
h:
“Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.” —
Winston Churchill

q: We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.
h:
“We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: If you build the guts to do something, anything, then you better save enough to face the consequences.
h:
“If you build the guts to do something, anything, then you better save enough to face the consequences.” —
Criss Jami

q: You're on earth. There's no cure for that.
h:
“You're on earth. There's no cure for that.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.
h:
“Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.
h:
“Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.” —
Og Mandino

q: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.
h:
“Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.” —
Martin Luther

q: Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.
h:
“Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.” —
Zhuangzi

q: If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?
h:
“If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?” —
Dogen

q: We can spend our whole lives escaping from the monsters of our minds.
h:
“We can spend our whole lives escaping from the monsters of our minds.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.
h:
“Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.” —
Unknown

q: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
h:
“The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.” —
Walt Disney

q: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
h:
“In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.
h:
“Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.
h:
“If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.
h:
“Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.” —
Sun Tzu

q: A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.
h:
“A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: When one door closes another door opens.
h:
“When one door closes another door opens. ” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: As you love yourself, life loves you back.
h:
“As you love yourself, life loves you back.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: I don't walk away from things that I think are unfinished.
h:
“I don't walk away from things that I think are unfinished.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
h:
“Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.” —
Voltaire

q: The person who is his own master cannot tolerate another boss.
h:
“The person who is his own master cannot tolerate another boss. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
h:
“The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The mind is the limit.
h:
“The mind is the limit.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Be the silent watcher of your thoughts and behavior. You are beneath the thinker.
h:
“Be the silent watcher of your thoughts and behavior. You are beneath the thinker.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Be where your enemy is not.
h:
“Be where your enemy is not.” —
Sun Tzu

q: To lose your temper is only useful once a year.
h:
“To lose your temper is only useful once a year.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.
h:
“The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
h:
“It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.
h:
“Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.
h:
“Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.” —
Robert Greene

q: People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.
h:
“People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.” —
Theodore Roosevelt
